column4: Why wouldnt my windows partition show up during installation?
Anyone?
chosen manual partitoning ?
tbh, i've never done this before. one i hit next after that, it'll let me configure it out i want to?
: the installer asks you , what have you selected ?
going wireless ?
nein. wired. dont even have a wireless card in this computer
you router provides dhcp ?
yep
open a terminal ..
sudo apt-get install pastebinit
i know what terminal is
sudo apt-get install pastebinit
but, i cant use apt-get if i dont have internet
sorry, my fault, paste the out from ifconfig then
i tried setting a static LAN ip, that i know was not in use, and i was still unable to ping my router.
right IP/netmask ? where did you set it up ?
are you chatting over this router now ? in which os ?
I'm using windows xp atm, which has internet fine
I see, did you install with the desktop live cd ?

boot into live then, copy the /etc/network/interfaces to an external medium, and try with that; also on the hd~8.10 there is the option safe-mode >> netroot, which mostly autoconfigures dhcp fine, so can look for interfaces there again
did you try the live and did it connect to your router ?
sudo dpkg-reconfigure
